title: Authors and Citation
text: Sonnenberg H (2022). kwb.mia.iw: InfoWorks related functions KWB project MIA-CSO. R package version 0.2.4.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kwb.mia.iw: InfoWorks related functions in KWB project MIA-CSO},   author = {Hauke Sonnenberg},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.2.4}, }

title: InfoWorks related functions in KWB project MIA-CSO
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install kwb.mia.iw in R install.packages('kwb.mia.iw')  # Browse the kwb.miacso manual pages help(package = 'kwb.mia.iw')

what: Create Gerris Input File for Constant Parameters — hsCreateGerrisInputConstParsCsv
title: Create Gerris Input File for Constant Parameters — hsCreateGerrisInputConstParsCsv
text: Create Gerris input file containing boundary conditions non-simulated   water quality parameters

title: Create Gerris Input File for Constant Parameters — hsCreateGerrisInputConstParsCsv
code: hsCreateGerrisInputConstParsCsv(   csvExample,   csvOut = NULL,   constParVals = hsGerrisConstParsMia(),   dbg = TRUE )

title: Create Gerris Input File for Constant Parameters — hsCreateGerrisInputConstParsCsv
text: csvExample path example csv file containing names Gerris boundary conditions first row, starting second column (first column timestamp) csvOut full path csv file non-simulated parameters written. missing, function returns character matrix containing file content. constParVals Data frame columns VO2, SI, VPH, VX0, VX02, ZOOIND, VKIGR, LF, MW, VNO2, VNO3, CA, CHLA, ANTBL containing values non-simulated parameters first row. Default: result hsGerrisConstParsMia(). dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

what: Write File for Gerris Import — hsCreateGerrisInputFile
title: Write File for Gerris Import — hsCreateGerrisInputFile
text: Write file Gerris import based database table generated   StatAnalysis-evaluation "IwToQSim".

title: Write File for Gerris Import — hsCreateGerrisInputFile
code: hsCreateGerrisInputFile(   mdb,   tbl,   gerrisParID,   csv.dir,   csv.file = paste0("forGerrisImport_", gerrisParID, ".csv"),   writeFile = TRUE,   tsFormat = .defaultTimeFormat(),   subst.na = "",   dbg = FALSE )

title: Write File for Gerris Import — hsCreateGerrisInputFile
text: mdb full path MS Access database containing table required data tbl name table exported csv file gerrisParID Gerris parameter ID: one "OBSB", "OCSB", "VNH4", "GESN", "GELP", "GESP", "SS", "Q" csv.dir path directory output file written csv.file optional name output file, default: "forGerrisImport_<gerrisParID>.csv" writeFile TRUE, file written, otherwise corresponding data returned function written file. tsFormat format timestamp used output file (%d = day, %m = month, %Y = year, %H = hour, %M = minute, %S = second) subst.na string value NULL values table subsubstituted output file dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Create Gerris Input Files — hsCreateGerrisInputFiles
text: Create Gerris input files database containing tables prepared    StatAna-Evaluation "eIwToQSim"

title: Create Gerris Input Files — hsCreateGerrisInputFiles
code: hsCreateGerrisInputFiles(   mdb,   csv.dir,   tblQ = "tbl_Q_m3_s",   tblBOD = "tbl_c_BOD_tot_mg_L",   tblCOD = "tbl_c_COD_tot_mg_L",   tblNH4N = "tbl_c_NH4N_mg_L",   tblNges = "tbl_c_NGES_mg_L",   tblTPdis = "tbl_c_TP_dis_mg_L",   tblTPtot = "tbl_c_TP_tot_mg_L",   tblTSS = "tbl_c_TSS_mg_L",   csv.basename = "forGerrisImport",   separate = TRUE,   overall = TRUE,   tsFormat = .defaultTimeFormat(),   subst.na = "",   dbg = FALSE )

title: Create Gerris Input Files — hsCreateGerrisInputFiles
text: mdb full path MS Access database (.mdb) containing tables prepared StatAna-Evaluation "eIwToQSim" csv.dir output directory database tables exported CSV format tblQ name table containing flows Q m3/s; default: "tbl_Q_m3_s" tblBOD name table containing BOD concentrations mg/L; default: "tbl_c_BOD_tot_mg_L" tblCOD name table containing COD concentrations mg/L; default: "tbl_c_COD_tot_mg_L" tblNH4N name table containing NH4-N concentrations mg/L; default: "tbl_c_NH4N_mg_L" tblNges name table containing N total concentrations mg/L; default: "tbl_c_NGES_mg_L" tblTPdis name table containing total P (dissolved) concentrations mg/L; default: "tbl_c_TP_dis_mg_L" tblTPtot name table containing total P concentrations mg/L; default: "tbl_c_TP_tot_mg_L" tblTSS name table containing TSS concentrations mg/L; default: "tbl_c_TSS_mg_L" csv.basename basename file(s) created csv.dir; default: "forGerrisImport". flows, "_Hydrax" appended basename, concentrations water quality parameters "_QSim_<par>", <par> one "OBSB", "OCSB", "VNH4", "GESN", "GELP", "GESP", "SS". file containing concentrations water quality parameters "_QSim_all" appended. separate TRUE, one file per parameter created. overall TRUE, one file containing parameters created. tsFormat format timestamp used output file (%d = day, %m = month, %Y = year, %H = hour, %M = minute, %S = second) subst.na substitution value NA values dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Size of InfoWorks Result CSV File — hsFileSize
text: nDays number days bytesHeader length header line bytes bytesRow length data row bytes timestep result timestep seconds dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Size of InfoWorks Result CSV File — hsFileSize
text: Size InfoWorks result CSV file nDays result timestep timestep seconds bytes header file    bytesHeader data row bytesRow bytes long.

title: Gerris Constant Boundary Matrix — hsGerrisConstBoundMatrix
text: Character matrix containing default values non-simulated parameters

title: Gerris Constant Boundary Matrix — hsGerrisConstBoundMatrix
code: hsGerrisConstBoundMatrix(boundNames, constPars, tstamp.1, tstamp.2, tstamp.n)

title: Gerris Constant Boundary Matrix — hsGerrisConstBoundMatrix
text: boundNames names locations boundary conditions given constPars values parameters treated constant boundary conditions tstamp.1 first timestamp tstamp.2 second timestamp tstamp.n last timestamp

title: Gerris Constant Parameters — hsGerrisConstParsMia
text: Gerris/QSim boundary conditions treated constant within MIA-CSO   project. Parameter names according definition Gerris configuration   file "GerrisParam.xml"

title: Gerris Constant Parameters — hsGerrisConstParsMia
code: hsGerrisConstParsMia(   VO2 = 0,   SI = 0,   VPH = 7.44,   VX0 = 0,   VX02 = 0,   ZOOIND = 0,   VKIGR = 0.33,   LF = 293.33,   MW = 1.39,   VNO2 = 0.21,   VNO3 = 1.1,   CA = 36.04,   CHLA = 0,   ANTBL = 0.33 )

title: Gerris Constant Parameters — hsGerrisConstParsMia
text: VO2 "Sauerstoffgehalt" mg/l SI "Silizium" mg/l VPH "pH-Wert" VX0 "Nitrosomonas" mg/l VX02 "Nitrobacter" mg/l ZOOIND "Rotatorien/Zooplanktondichte" Ind/l VKIGR "Kieselalgen/Anteil der Kieselalgen Gesamt-Chlorophyll-", 0..1 LF Leitfaehigkeit" mikro-S/cm MW "m-Wert" mmol/l VNO2 "Nitrit-N" mg/l VNO3 "Nitrat-N" mg/l CA "Calcium" mg/l CHLA "Chlorophyll-" mikro-g/l ANTBL "Blaualgen/Anteil der Blaualgen Gesamt-Chlorophyll-", 0..1

title: Gerris Constant Parameters — hsGerrisConstParsMia
text: Data frame columns VO2, SI, VPH, VX0, VX02, ZOOIND, VKIGR, LF, MW, VNO2, VNO3, CA, CHLA, ANTBL containing   default values non-simulated parameters first row

text: Get Infoworks Result Average CSV

title: Get Infoworks Result Average From CSV — hsGetIwResultAvgFromCsv
code: hsGetIwResultAvgFromCsv(csvdir, type, qthreshold = 0.003, dbg = TRUE)

title: Get Infoworks Result Average From CSV — hsGetIwResultAvgFromCsv
text: csvdir directory InfoWorks result files (csv) located type one "flow", "BOD_tot", "COD_tot", "NH4N", "TKN_tot", "TP_dis",  "TP_tot", "TSS" qthreshold threshold Q values dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

what: Get Infoworks Result Average From MS Access Database — hsGetIwResultAvgFromMdb
title: Get Infoworks Result Average From MS Access Database — hsGetIwResultAvgFromMdb
text: Get Infoworks Result Average MS Access Database

title: Get Infoworks Result Average From MS Access Database — hsGetIwResultAvgFromMdb
code: hsGetIwResultAvgFromMdb(   mdb,   type,   tblQ = "tbl_05_Q_bei_Ueberlauf_m3_s",   tblL = paste("tbl_02_15minMittel_L", type, "kg_s", sep = "_"),   skipCols = c("^kug$", "^overall$") )

title: Get Infoworks Result Average From MS Access Database — hsGetIwResultAvgFromMdb
text: mdb mdb type type tblQ name database table containing flows tblL name database table containing loads skipCols vector patterns matching names columns skipped

title: Integrals — hsIntegrals
text: Calculates integrals (sum value columns within event's time    interval, multiplied "signal width" events)

title: Integrals — hsIntegrals
code: hsIntegrals(data, evts, dbg = FALSE)

title: Integrals — hsIntegrals
text: data time-series data timestamp first column evts event data describing events contained data dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Integrals — hsIntegrals
text: vector integral values one value per event. Length vector   corresponds number rows evts

what: Volume and Mass Load per Event — hsIwEventSummary
title: Volume and Mass Load per Event — hsIwEventSummary
text: Volume Mass Load per Event

title: Volume and Mass Load per Event — hsIwEventSummary
code: hsIwEventSummary(   src,   mfpars = c("flow", "BOD_tot", "COD_tot", "NH4N", "TKN_tot", "TP_dis", "TP_tot",     "TSS") )

title: Volume and Mass Load per Event — hsIwEventSummary
text: src Data source; can either path mdb (filled StatAna) directory containing original csv files exported InfoWorks mfpars Vector parameter acronyms; Default: c("flow", "BOD_tot", "COD_tot", "NH4N", "TKN_tot", "TP_dis", "TP_tot", "TSS")

title: Volume and Mass Load per Event — hsIwEventSummary
text: list event list evts, matrix allIntegrals  containing volume mass loads per event data.frame iwdata  containing result data

text: Infoworks Plot 1

code: hsIwPlot1(   data,   allIntegrals,   evts,   type = 2,   basemain,   legend.sort = FALSE,   ylog = FALSE,   yBottom = ifelse(ylog, 1e-04, 0),   cex.legend = 0.55 )

title: Infoworks Plot 1 — hsIwPlot1
text: data data allIntegrals allIntegrals evts evts type default: 2 basemain basemain legend.sort default: FALSE ylog default: FALSE yBottom default: ifelse(ylog, 0.0001, 0) cex.legend expansion factor legend texts

text: Infoworks Plot 2

code: hsIwPlot2(   allIntegrals,   evts,   plotTotal = TRUE,   plotEvents = FALSE,   pars = c("TSS", "COD_tot", "BOD_tot", "TKN_tot", "NH4N", "TP_tot", "TP_dis") )

title: Infoworks Plot 2 — hsIwPlot2
text: allIntegrals allIntegrals evts evts plotTotal default: TRUE plotEvents default: FALSE pars default: c("TSS", "COD_tot", "BOD_tot", "TKN_tot", "NH4N", "TP_tot", "TP_dis")

text: Infoworks Plot 3

title: Infoworks Plot 3 — hsIwPlot3
code: hsIwPlot3(allIntegrals, boxplot.range = 0)

title: Infoworks Plot 3 — hsIwPlot3
text: allIntegrals allIntegrals boxplot.range determines far plot whiskers extend box. See argument range barplot.

title: Infoworks Plot All — hsIwPlotAll
text: Infoworks Plot

title: Infoworks Plot All — hsIwPlotAll
code: hsIwPlotAll(   src,   subtitle = "",   mfpars = c("flow", "BOD_tot", "COD_tot", "NH4N", "TKN_tot", "TP_dis", "TP_tot",     "TSS"),   ylog = FALSE,   type = 2,   outpdf = "",   outdir = "",   legend.sort = FALSE,   cex.legend = 0.55 )

title: Infoworks Plot All — hsIwPlotAll
text: src Data source; can either path mdb (filled StatAna) directory containing original csv files exported InfoWorks subtitle subtitle mfpars Vector parameter acronyms; Default: c("flow", "BOD_tot", "COD_tot", "NH4N", "TKN_tot", "TP_dis", "TP_tot", "TSS") ylog y axis logarithmic? type default: 2 outpdf Path output file (.pdf). Default: "" outdir Path output directory. Default: "" legend.sort default: FALSE cex.legend expansion factor legend texts

what: InfoWorks Result CSV File Size — hsIwResultFileSize
title: InfoWorks Result CSV File Size — hsIwResultFileSize
text: Size InfoWorks result CSV file depending simulated time period   dateFirst dateLast, result timestep    timestep applied number nDataCol data columns    file.

title: InfoWorks Result CSV File Size — hsIwResultFileSize
code: hsIwResultFileSize(   dateFirst,   dateLast,   timestep,   nDataCol,   bytesHeader = -1,   tstamp = "yyyy-mm-dd hh:nn:ss",   colWidth = 12,   dbg = FALSE )

title: InfoWorks Result CSV File Size — hsIwResultFileSize
text: dateFirst first date (day) simulated ISO-format: yyyy-mm-dd dateLast last date (day) simulated ISO-format: yyyy-mm-dd timestep result timestep seconds nDataCol number data columns (time-columns excluded) InfoWorks result CSV file bytesHeader length header line bytes tstamp string representing example timestamp colWidth width data column bytes dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: InfoWorks Result CSV File Size — hsIwResultFileSize
text: List elements Bytes, kB, MB, GB  giving requested file size according unit.

title: Plot Type 1 — hsTimeBarPlot
text: Plot type 1: boxes mean flow height event duration width

title: Plot Type 1 — hsTimeBarPlot
code: hsTimeBarPlot(   t1,   t2,   height,   tlim = c(min(t1), max(t2)),   ylim = NULL,   ylog = TRUE,   ymult = c(1, 2, 3, 5),   main = "hsTimeBarPlot",   tlab = "time",   ylab = "height",   time.format = .defaultDateFormat(),   tlab.mindist = 86400,   col = "grey",   cex.all = 0.8,   cex.legend = cex.all,   cex.text = cex.all,   cex.axis = cex.all,   legend.values = height,   legend.sort = TRUE,   legend.format = .defaultLegendFormat(),   legend.title = "Legend:",   mar = c(6, 5, 5, 10) )

title: Plot Type 1 — hsTimeBarPlot
text: t1 begin times bars t2 end times bars height bar heights tlim limits time axis. Default: c(min(t1), max(t2)) ylim limits y axis, Default: c(min(height), max(height)) ylog TRUE, y axis scaled logarithmically, else linearly ymult numbers multiplied exponents ten labelling y axis ylog TRUE main plot title tlab label time axis ylab label y axis time.format format time axis labels tlab.mindist minimum "time distance" time labels, seconds col bar colour cex.general expansion factor applied cex.legend, cex.text, cex.axis, given cex.legend expansion factor legend texts cex.text expansion factor texts within plot (bar numbers) cex.axis expansion factor axis labels legend.values values shown legend, default: height values legend.sort TRUE, legend sorted decreasingly legend.values legend.format format string used sprintf generation legend entries legend values, e.g. "V = %8.0f m3" legend.title legend title mar plot margins

what: Result Time Step in InfoWorks Result CSV File — hsTsInFile
title: Result Time Step in InfoWorks Result CSV File — hsTsInFile
text: Result Time Step InfoWorks Result CSV File

title: Result Time Step in InfoWorks Result CSV File — hsTsInFile
code: hsTsInFile(bytesFile, bytesHeader, bytesRow, nDays)

title: Result Time Step in InfoWorks Result CSV File — hsTsInFile
text: bytesFile file length bytes bytesHeader length header line bytes bytesRow lengh data row bytes nDays number days

title: Result Time Step in InfoWorks Result CSV File — hsTsInFile
text: Returns (possibly) applied result timestep InfoWorks simulation    depending maximal allowed InfoWorks result CSV file size bytesFile  bytes, number nDays days simulate size bytesHeader bytesRow header data   line, respectively.

title: kwb.mia.iw 0.2.4
text: Harmonise package kwb.pkgbuild Added NEWS.md file track changes package. see https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html writing good NEWS.md

title: kwb.mia.iw 0.2.3
text: hsGetIwResultAvgAboveZero(): check .accdb hsIwPlotAll(): bug fix checking .accdb extension

title: kwb.mia.iw 0.2.2
text: new: hsIwEventSummary() hsIwPlotAll(): call hsIwEventSummary(), save summary “tbl_Stat” mdb
